1.description: First, add the switch to the designated panel area of the object, ensuring it is positioned for easy accessibility and user interaction. This switch is crucial as it will serve as the primary control mechanism, allowing users to turn the device on or off, thus initiating its functions and enhancing overall usability.

2.description: Next, add the surface base directly beneath the switch to provide a sturdy foundation for the entire assembly, ensuring stability and support for the switch's operation. This base acts as the primary structural element that connects to the underlying framework, allowing the switch to function correctly while also serving as a mounting point for additional components in subsequent steps.

3.description: Then, add the vertical support by positioning it centrally on the surface base, extending upwards from the base to provide a sturdy framework for the object. This support is crucial as it will bear the weight of the components that will be attached later, ensuring stability and durability while connecting the switch to the overall structure.

4.description: Then, add the Horizontal Support across the top of the Vertical Support, positioning it parallel to the Surface Base; this component enhances the structural integrity of the assembly by providing additional stability and evenly distributing weight across the frame. This connection not only reinforces the vertical elements but also creates a platform for potential attachments or components that may be added in subsequent steps.

5.description: Then, add the tube vertically along the center of the surface base, connecting it securely to the horizontal support. This tube serves as a conduit for wires and other components, ensuring they are organized and protected while maintaining structural integrity between the switch and the overall assembly.

6.description: Finally, add the mouth at the end of the tube, ensuring it faces outward to facilitate the intended function of the object, such as airflow or sound emission. This addition not only completes the structure but also reinforces the connection between the tube and the overall assembly, ensuring that all components work harmoniously together.
